pullRequest.body:
Rewrite cylinders and projective families of measures in terms of `Finset.restrict`. This avoids type ascription, and allows to rewrite a restriction as the composition of two restrictions, which is helpful when manipulating projective families.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

### PR summary [926ae9d055](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16327/commits/926ae9d055f5fc3476e196f9c42e956b5259141f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`++ restrict_def`
`++ restrictâ‚‚_def`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16300~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16328~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

I did not want `Finset.restrict` and co to be unfolded by the simplifier when only partially applied, but this broke some `simp` proofs, that's why I added the `config`. Another way I thought of would be to add some lemma `restrict_def` which unfolds the partial app. It shouldn't be a `simp` lemma, but could be passed as an argument to `simp` or used with `rw`. In fact at the time I wrote the code I was a bit frustrated that natural `simp` proofs broke and did not want to add a new lemma to fix it because it would require to know about that lemma, but maybe I should go for this option instead?
Adding the lemma `restrict_def` seems the way to go. Don't give it the `simp` attribute but add it to the list of lemmas used by the `simp` calls in those proofs.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10920146232/job/30309372724)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10920146232/job/30309373014)
This looks like a clear improvement, apart from all the `config := { unfoldPartialApp := true }`. Why are they needed? Is there a way to add API to something to make them go away?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: rewrite cylinders and projective families of measures in terms of `Finset.restrict`

nodes.body:
### PR summary [926ae9d055](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16327/commits/926ae9d055f5fc3476e196f9c42e956b5259141f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`++ restrict_def`
`++ restrictâ‚‚_def`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16300~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16328~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
This looks like a clear improvement, apart from all the `config := { unfoldPartialApp := true }`. Why are they needed? Is there a way to add API to something to make them go away?

I did not want `Finset.restrict` and co to be unfolded by the simplifier when only partially applied, but this broke some `simp` proofs, that's why I added the `config`. Another way I thought of would be to add some lemma `restrict_def` which unfolds the partial app. It shouldn't be a `simp` lemma, but could be passed as an argument to `simp` or used with `rw`. In fact at the time I wrote the code I was a bit frustrated that natural `simp` proofs broke and did not want to add a new lemma to fix it because it would require to know about that lemma, but maybe I should go for this option instead?
Adding the lemma `restrict_def` seems the way to go. Don't give it the `simp` attribute but add it to the list of lemmas used by the `simp` calls in those proofs.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10920146232/job/30309372724)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10920146232/job/30309373014)
